  Same nucleus stained with DAPI and recorded with a CCD camera. The Barr body
  is indicated by the arrow, it identifies the inactive X (Xi). ]] The 'X
  chromosome' is one of the two sex-determining chromosomes in many animal
  species, including mammals (the other is the Y chromosome) and is found in
  both males and females. It is a part of the XY sex-determination system and X0
  sex-determination system. The 'X' chromosome was named for its unique
  properties by early researchers, which resulted in the naming of its
  counterpart 'Y' chromosome, for the next letter in the alphabet, after it was
  discovered later. {{cite web
